title: Suburbarazzi's Star Map
name: Suburbarazzi's Star Map
description:
A Map by Tedmann

This is guide to the many celebrities that live in New York's Lower Hudson Vally (including Westchester, Rockland, and Putnam Counties). 

Please note: This map does not include any specific home addresses, just the towns that famous people live in, as well as public spots where they've been sighted. 

To read more about the celebs of the Lower Hudson Valley, visit &lt;a href=&quot;http://suburbarazzi.lohudblogs.com&quot;&gt;&lt;b&gt;Suburbarazzi&lt;/b&gt;&lt;/a&gt;.

properties.name: Aaron Hug Boy Perez
properties.description: Posted by Tedmann142 Peekskill Hollow Rd, Putnam Valley, NYThe Putnam Valley Middle School student was suspended for asking his teacher for a hug, and went on to achieve international superstar status.

properties.name: Aaron Sorkin
properties.description: Posted by TedmannScarsdale, NYGrew up in Scarsdale

properties.name: Adam Levy
properties.description: Posted by TedmannCarmel, NYLives in Carmel and is currently running for Putnam District Attorney. The son of Judge Judy Sheindlin, also a former Putnam County resident. Represented actor Rip Torn in December 2006 DWI, as well as a previous DWI in New York City.

properties.name: Adam Rodriguez
properties.description: Posted by TedmannNew City, NYThe star of CSI: Miami grew up and went to high school in New City, NY.

properties.name: Al Roker
properties.description: Posted by TedmannYorktown, NYMeteorologist Al Roker used to live in Yorktown. His ex-wife, Alice, is still the Town Clerk.

properties.description: Posted by TedmannGrew up on Woods Road in Sneden\'s Landing. Attended William O. Schaefer School in Tappan.

properties.name: B-52's
properties.description: Posted by TedmannMahopac, NYIn 1980, flush with the success of their debut album, the band purchased a home in Mahopac. As bandmember Kate put it in a magazine interview in 1982, "We moved up here and bought a house together. It\'s in Mahopac which is right in the wilds. It\'s more of a creative retreat now. We\'re very isolated up there. It\'s full of retired people that want us to leave in case we drive the value of the property down."

properties.name: Beyonce & Jay-Z
properties.description: Posted by TedmannÂ 15 Heathcote Rd, Scarsdale, NYIt\'s been reported that Jay-Z and Beyonce are building a home on Heathcote Road in Scarsdale. The couple also obtained a marriage license in the town earlier this year.

properties.name: Diana Ross
properties.description: Posted by Tedmann55 Dicks Castle Rd., Garrison, NYThe legendary singer wanted to buy Dick\'s Castle in Garrison, but ultimately didn\'t because the sellers denied her request to put in a helicopter landing pad. Sylvester Stallone was also in serious negotiations for to buy the castle, but his plans also fell through.

properties.description: Posted by TedmannSpring Valley, NYThe actress was born in Spring Valley, attended grade School at Green Meadow School, and got her B.A. degree in art history from Sarah Lawrence College in Bronxville.

properties.name: Katherine Heigl
properties.description: Posted by Tedmann11 Farm Rd, New Canaan, CTAfter her family settled in a large, old Victorian-style farmhouse in New Canaan, Heigl went on to attend New Canaan High School, balancing her film and modeling work with her academic studies. Her parents divorced in 1996 and her mother was diagnosed with cancer. After her high school graduation in 1997, she moved with her mother into a 4-bedroom house in Malibu Canyon, Los Angeles, and her mother became her manager.

properties.name: Keith Bulluck
properties.description: Posted by Tedmann151 Congers Rd, New City, NYThe linebacker for the Tennessee Titans was born in Suffern and played football for Clarkstown North High School in New City.

properties.name: Matt Lauer
properties.description: Posted by Tedmann475 W Hartsdale Ave, Greenburgh, NYLauer attended Woodlands High School in Greenburgh. He moved to Hartsdale with his mother after his parents divorced. Prior to living there, he lived in Ardsley (next to ice cream tycoon Tom Carvel) until 4th grade, and before that he lived in Chappaqua until the 1st grade.

properties.name: Mel Gibson
properties.description: Posted by TedmannVerplanck, NYBorn on the 3rd of January, 1956, in Peekskill, New York, the sixth of eleven children. His father, Hutton, was a brakeman for New York Central Railroad and, considering New York City no place to raise children, moved the family north to Croton-on-Hudson, then on to nearby Verplanck Point and, by 1961, on to a farmhouse at Mount Vision.

Rumors are swirling that a tell-all book on the television news industry is in the works for the former "Live and Direct" host.

properties.description: Posted by Tedmann37 N Broadway, Nyack, NYRussell Crowe, William Hurt, Didi Conn, Bill Murray, and Stephen Baldwin have all picked up pastries at this Nyack bakery. It was also used regularly as a setpiece on the NBC television series "Ed." And Stephen Baldwin has also given press conferences from inside the bakery.

properties.name: Stephanie Seymour
properties.description: Posted by Tedmann383 Greenwich Ave, Greenwich, CTSupermodel and Greenwich resident Stephanie Seymour has been spotted pondering cupcakes and eclairs with her two sons at St. Moritz Bakery on Greenwich Avenue.

properties.name: Taylor Hicks
properties.description: Posted by TedmannSeason 5 âAmerican Idolâ champ Taylor Hicks and other celebs appeared at Winged Foot Gold Club in Mamaroneck on June 11, 2007, to fundraise for an autism charity at the ninth-annual Celebrity Golf Challenge.

properties.name: That Girl
properties.description: Posted by TedmannBrewster, NYThe character of Ann Marie (played by Marlo Thomas) on the popular TV series (which aired from 1966-71) was supposed to have grown up in rural Brewster before moving to The Big Apple.

properties.name: The Sopranos
properties.description: Posted by Tedmann1 Hemlock Point Road, Putnam Valley, NYThe Sopranos shot in Putnam Valley in July of â06 at the home of Cynthia Scheider, ex-wife of âJawsâ star Roy Scheider, on the scenic Oscawana Lake. The 1,600-square-foot cottage is on Hemlock Point Road and was also used in the filming of 2003âs âMona Lisa Smile.â The production crew was seen at the time parked along Peekskill Hollow Road and they showed up daily for sandwiches at the Putnam Valley Market. The home was used as a summer cottage for characters of Janice Soprano and Bobby \'Bacala\' Baccalieri, and in the episode Tony and Carmela Soprano visit for a weekend and Tony gets into a drunken fistfight with Bobby.

properties.name: Tracy Chapman
properties.description: Posted by Tedmann91 Miry Brook Rd, Danbury, CTChapman won an ABC (A Better Chance) scholarship to the prestigious Wooster School, a prep school in Danbury, Connecticut. She honed her songwriting skills in the school\'s coffeehouse, starred on its basketball and soccer teams, and was heavily recruited by several top colleges as she approached her graduation in 1982.

properties.name: Treat Williams
properties.description: Posted by TedmannRowayton, CTThe actor was born in Rowayton, Connecticut to Richard Norman Williams, a prize-fighter, and his wife Marion Treat, a housewife, for whom he is named. Williams graduated from the Kent School in Connecticut.
